intro: Spitzelia atlantica, commonly known as the Atlantic spitzelia, is a species of flowering plant native to the coastal regions of South America. It is a member of the Poaceae family, commonly known as grasses, and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and narrow leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically arranged in dense clusters at the ends of its stems. Spitzelia atlantica thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in dune environments. It plays a role in stabilizing coastal dunes and is adapted to withstand salt spray and strong winds.
